page.description: Returns TRUE if the field is blank.

argument.name: fieldname
argument.description: The name of a table field used in a form or browse.

page.discussion: ISBLANK() returns .T. (TRUE) if the field identified in the Field_Name is blank; otherwise, it returns .F. (FALSE). This function works on any type of field. The function can be used is event coding for forms and browses. Note : To test for a blank string, use ISNULL().

section.example: ? isblank("ADDRESS2") = .T. isblank(FIELD_NAME) -> TRUE, if the FIELD_NAME variable contains "ADDRESS2" and the ADDRESS2 field is empty.

section.description: If the FIELD_NAME variable contains "ADDRESS2" and the ADDRESS2 field is empty.
